page.title: 01Wivelsfield - Gazetteer Page
page.content:
{Wivelsfield}is predominantly an area of farmland with some woodland and three small population centres.
It is fairly flat with an East/West ridge, the underlying cretaceous rocks are of the mesozoic age and the soil mostly Wealden clay. Two brooks wind through roughly East to West.
As the prevailing winds are from the SSW, the area is sheltered by the South Downs and enjoys an equitable climate.
One main road, the B2112 ,runs through the centre linking the market town of Haywards Heath with the historic village of Ditchling. The London to Brighton railway line passes from North to South providing a vital commuter route.
